Constructor Detail

Camera

public Camera()
Method Detail

addUpdateLock

public void addUpdateLock()
If there is a lock, it will keep the update method from being called in another thread (or the current thread for that matter). To avoid bad locking (program freezing up), always unlock before exiting your function or calling update.

If you are not using threads, DO NOT CALL THIS FUNCTION. If you do not know what threading is, DO NOT CALL THIS FUNCTION. It is better to not call this function than to call it and mess it up. (although it is prefered that you use this function correctly) This function is so very dangerous to use incorrectly that it is hard to explain in words.

ALWAYS FOLLOW THIS FUNCTION WITH removeUpdateLock();

removeUpdateLock

public void removeUpdateLock()

isLocked

public boolean isLocked()

isNewDataAvailable

public boolean isNewDataAvailable()
Determine if tracking data is available which is newer than the data processed by the last call to update().

Returns:
True if new value is available, false otherwise

update

public void update()
Process tracking data for a new frame and make it available for retrieval by the other methods.

See Also:
isNewDataAvailable()

getFrameNumber

public int getFrameNumber()
Use to return value is the frame number used to generate the tracking data.

Returns:
the frame number used to genenerate the tracking code
See Also:
update(), getCaptureTime()

getAvailableBlobLength

public int getAvailableBlobLength(int ch)
Use to return the number of blobs available for the channel ch, which is a color channel numbered 0 through 3.

Parameters:
ch - from channel (range 0-2)
See Also:
init(), update()

getBlob

public Blob getBlob(int ch,
                    int blob)
Gets blob at the specified index. This is essentially the same as making a new BlobList from this Camera and calling get on it.

Parameters:
blob - the index of the desired blob

getCaptureTime

public int getCaptureTime()
Gets the timestamp (in milliseconds) of the current frame

Returns:
The timestamp (in milliseconds) of the current frame
See Also:
getFrameNumber(), getPreviousCaptureTime()

getPreviousCaptureTime

public int getPreviousCaptureTime()
Return the timestamp (in milliseconds) of the previous frame, as captured by vision hardware. This is not necessarily the same as captureTime from the prevous track_update in the case where update was called less quickly than frames were captured and thus skipped one or more frame captures.

Returns:
The timestamp (in milliseconds) of the current frame
See Also:
getFrameNumber(), getCaptureTime()
